Wan Lai woke up with a wave of his wide sleeves. From the center of the West Lake, a waterfowl flew into the wet dawn, and then fell towards the ripples on Hongshang. Under the moon, the silver halo circulated in my tears, the white dew condensed silently on the sweet-scented osmanthus, and the fragrance overflowed from the tender pistils of the water lily, and became cold on the luminous lake. Liang Lu gently rang Shuiyue, and the voice followed the south wind through the window lattice and went straight into the palace. After a while, the lake surface was calm again. He circulated his left hand, hovering with his right hand, lightly dialing the stars on both sides of the Tianhe River, and then suppressed and destroyed, dived and flew like a peregrine falcon with both hands. Jiao Zheng rose up one after another, and suddenly jumped into the frosty sky; the palace merchants behind were like harriers chasing after flying with wings, rushing into the open air rushing into the frost wind. The ten fingers are leaping swiftly, like a frightened gull from a rabbit, or a wild goose descending abruptly in the desert: the westerly wind is rolled up from the bamboo forest, and the leaves are swayed and the smoke is collected by the river. The ten fingers were flying swiftly, splashing the rain on the windows and duckweed, rustling like a changing sword flower, rising and falling back and dancing, popping up petals of the morning glow. The snow is clear, the mountains are quiet, and the glaciers are silent. At the summit of Kunlun, the golden sun shot down purple crystals. In the ruby, the pearl glows quietly like a nebula. Then there was a sudden rush of five fingers... When the crystal and melting ice collided suddenly, the silver light of Daxue Mountain suddenly condensed high in the sky. And Tianhe is also as still as a sword. Above the vast desert, the moonlight flowed through Yunhan, and the silent palace and cornices went away under the moon to hear the sound of immortals, and drove across the glazed glaze of the first cold into the nine days.
